com.salesforce.androidsdk.app
Class ForceApp

java.lang.Object
  Application
      com.salesforce.androidsdk.app.ForceApp

public abstract class ForceApp
extends Application

Super class for all force applications. You should extend this class or make sure to initialize HttpAccess in your application's onCreate method.

          Instance of the ForceApp to use for this process.

Method Detail

onCreate

public void onCreate()

getPasscodeManager

public PasscodeManager getPasscodeManager()
Returns:
The passcode manager associated with the app.

getPasscodeHash

public java.lang.String getPasscodeHash()
Returns:
The hashed passcode, or null if it's not required.

getApplicationName

public java.lang.String getApplicationName()
Returns:
The name of the application (as defined in AndroidManifest.xml).

getEncryptionHashConfig

protected PasscodeManager.HashConfig getEncryptionHashConfig()
Returns:
Hash salts and key to use for creating the hash of the passcode used for encryption. Unique for installation.

getVerificationHashConfig

protected PasscodeManager.HashConfig getVerificationHashConfig()
Returns:
The hash salt and key to use for creating the hash of the passcode used for verification. Unique to the installation.

logout

public void logout(Activity frontActivity)
Wipe out the stored authentication credentials (remove account) and restart the app.

getUserAgent

public final java.lang.String getUserAgent()
Returns:
The user agent string to use for all requests.

getAccountType

public java.lang.String getAccountType()
Returns:
The authentication account type (should match authenticator.xml).

toString

public java.lang.String toString()

getLockTimeoutMinutes

public abstract int getLockTimeoutMinutes()
Note: If you return 0, the user will not have to enter a passcode.

Returns:
The lock timeout in minutes, or 0 for never.

getMainActivityClass

public abstract java.lang.Class<? extends Activity> getMainActivityClass()
Returns:
The class for the main activity.

getSalesforceR

public abstract SalesforceR getSalesforceR()
Returns:
SalesforceR object which allows reference to resources living outside the SDK.

getKey

protected abstract java.lang.String getKey(java.lang.String name)
This function must return the same value for name even when the application is restarted.

Parameters:
name - The name associated with they key.
Returns:
The key used for encrypting salts and keys.
